H0.text: Wood is a substance that is magnetic and conducts heat.

H1.text: Plastic is the substance that is magnetic and conducts heat.

H2.text: Iron is a substance that is magnetic and conducts heat.

H3.text: Paper is a substance that is magnetic and conducts heat.

A4.text: Below its Curie point of 770 °C (1,420 °F; 1,040 K), α-iron changes from paramagnetic to ferromagnetic: the spins of the two unpaired electrons in each atom generally align with the spins of its neighbors, creating an overall magnetic field.
